bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Felipe Ponce Carbonell, February 12, 1948

div1.p: Hench writes that he is still working to memorialize Camp Lazear, but cannot proceed until he knows the Cubans will support upkeep of the site. Hench will be coming to Cuba and would like to meet with Carbonell regarding this matter.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Felipe Ponce Carbonell, February 12, 1948
div1.opener:
February 12, 1948
Dr. Felipe Carbonell Ponce
San Lazaro 413
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor PonceCarbonell:
div1.p:
In the past you have expressed an interest in my idea to preserve
the caseta on the Finca San Jose where Walter Reed and his colleagues con-
ducted the experiments on the cause of yellow fever which were begun years
before by Doctor Finlay who himself also actually used the Finca San Jose
in some of his early experiments. It is my purpose to try to memorialize
this spot in honor of both Doctor Finlay and the American Commission.
There is enough glory for all and I have no interest in any acrimonious
debate about the relative merits of these great scientists.

I feel sure that I can get substantial American financial support
for the venture but I cannot proceed until I know whether or to what extent
the Cuban government or Cuban medical profession would give support to this
venture of up-keep, proper care, and so forth. For this purpose, Mrs. Hench
and I are coming to Cuba. Our present plan is to arrive at the Hotel Nacional
Monday, March 1 and I plan to be in Havana a week. I shall first contact Mr.
John Moran of Havana, one of Reed's associates, whom I believe you know well.
I would appreciate it greatly if I could call upon you at your convenience
soon after my arrival. Should you wish to give me any instructions as to when
I might meet you, I would appreciate it if you would use the enclosed stamped
envelope. I shall be at the Villa Atlantique, Palm Beach, Florida, from
February 20 to 29 unless the weather is bad, in which case I might arrive
in Cuba a few days earlier.

It will be indeed a pleasure to me to meet you and I appreciate greatly
the opportunity of doing so.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
